DataElement.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group Patient Specimen Special Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the Southwest Oncology Group, an NCI-sponsored adult cancer clinical trials organization, patient's consent to use of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for special research purposes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group Patient Specimen Special Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the Southwest Oncology Group, an NCI-sponsored adult cancer clinical trials organization, patient's special consent to use of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) is an NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: An NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Surpassing what is common or usual or expected.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Surpassing what is common or usual or expected.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This information has not been sought (e.g., patient was not asked)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: My specimens may be used for
ReferenceDocuments.description: My specimens may be used for the special testing described as part of this study.

DataElement.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
